Description: Tunic fragment; a clavus in tapestry (a) applied and sewn to an undyed wool tunic in plain weave; on the left of the clavus is a band of tapestry - probably the breast ornament of the neck opening (b); the calvus has a finial ending in a medallion, the centre of the medallion is decorated with a human bust and the main part of the clavus is decoration with two horsemen (top and bottom), one orientated to the left and the other to the right, the right horse wears a heart-shaped pendant, the two men wear brown tunics and an orange mantle or trousers?, the horsemen at the top has a small cross on his breast and his head is surrounded with a halo (maybe a saint); between the horsemen is a human figure with a haloed head and wearing a non-Egyptian costume with large trousers and a green tunic; the figures are surrounded with small signs on a beige background - possible pseudo inscriptions; the figures and bust are framed with a freize of vegetal interlacing in yellow, red and green on beige background; there is a final freize of multi-coloured geometrical motifs; clavus has been sewn to the tunic and on the upper part there is another part of a clavus that had been applied and sewn, with human figures in the opposite direction, this indicates that this was the shoulder of the tunic; the breast ornament is a band of tapestry with a red background and beige vegetal interlacing creating lozenges, in the centre of which are geometric and stylised floral motifs;a small part of the woollen tunic remains on the right side; plain weave: undyed wool (S/12), weft-undyed wool (S/48); (a) tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/11), weft-undyed linen (S/68), yellow, pink, red, blue, dark blue, brown wool (S/60): (b) tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply)/12), weft-undyed linen (S/44), red and green wool (S/60); sewing: undyed linen (S spun Z ply) in oversewing
Curator's comments: textile with the ref. no 1887,0402.106 is probably a part of the same textile and so is 'tapestry'
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
